result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcos A Avila was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Submit DNA sample.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  AODA and comply.  6 month review. Defendant may petition Court in writing, after three years, for expunction of record, contingent upon no new law violations and fine paid in full.

***AMENDED*** 12/08/15 Order for jail to be with Huber.

Defendant Marcos A Avila in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called: 14CF130, 14CF194, 14CF254, & 13CM747. In cases 14CF194 & 14CF254  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Information filed, reading waived. In all cases.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant plead no contest to Ct. 1 of 14CF254 and no contest to Ct. 1 of 14CF194.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Case 14CF254 Ct. 1 Court withheld sentencing placed defendant on probation for 3 years.  $518.00 costs.  Submit DNA sample.  Maintain absolute sobriety. AODA and comply.  30 days jail with Huber, start date to be determined by agent, but must be within first year of probation.  6 month review.  Defendant may petition Court in writing, after three years, for expunction of record, contingent upon no new law violations and fine paid in full.  Dismiss but read in Counts 2,3, & 4.  Case 14CF194 Ct. 1  court withheld sentencing, placed defendant on probation for 3 years.  $518.00 costs.  Submit DNA sample.  Maintain absolute sobriety. AODA and comply. 6 month review.  Defendant may petition Court in writing, after three years, for expunction of record, contingent upon no new law violations and fine paid in full.  2 days jail credit due.  Any bond on hand to be applied towards costs.  Dismiss but read in Counts 2,3,4,5,6, & 7.   Cases 13CM747 and 14CF130 Dismissed but read in.
